physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. There is a wide road starting from the bottom of the photograph and extending towards the top-right. There are rows of parked cars along the road. On the left, there is a waterfront. There is a built structure extending outwards onto the water. There are several small boats near the port. Several larger ships can be seen in the background, further from the waterfront. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of former Clifford Pier
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Waterfronts
